paper_abstract: Intuitionistic fuzzy sets (IF-sets) create a suitable tool to describe cases where it is useful to account not only the grade of membership to a certain collection, but also the grade of its non-membership. We consider the alpha-cuts of an IF-set A as crisp sets consisting of those elements x for which the truth value (in fuzzy logic) of the statement "x belongs to A and it is not true that x does not belong to A" is at least a. We describe properties of such cuts depending on the chosen type of conjunction and negation. (C) 2013 Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Cuts of intuitionistic fuzzy sets respecting fuzzy connectives
